text: For other people named Jean Jones, see Jean Jones (disambiguation) Jean Jones (born 1932), is a former international lawn bowler from Jersey. She won a silver medal in the pairs at the 1996 World Outdoor Bowls Championship in Leamington Spa with Sheila Syvret. She also competed in the Commonwealth games during 1998. ==References== Category:Jersey female bowls players Category:1932 births Category:Bowls players at the 1998 Commonwealth Games Category:Living people
title: Jean Jones (lawn bowler)
